definition: cabin/the hold of a ship or airplane
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: When the hot weather hits many people decide to go to the beaches and to cabins by lakes.
sentences.chinese: 當炎熱的天氣訪問許多人決定去海灘和艙房的湖泊。

sentences.english: Please book me a cabin on the ship.
sentences.chinese: 請替我在船上訂一間艙房。

sentences.english: Let me see. Our cabin is on the main deck.
sentences.chinese: 我看看，我們的艙房在主甲板上。

sentences.english: Every compartment had some minor breakage or malfunction to report .
sentences.chinese: 每間艙房總有些小毛病或機件失靈的事故上報。

sentences.english: He went into the great cabin.
sentences.chinese: 布萊克松走進了艦隊司令的大艙房。

sentences.english: May I change to a stateroom with an ocean view?
sentences.chinese: 請問可以改換有海景窗戶的艙房嗎？

sentences.english: The first class compartment is at the front of the train.
sentences.chinese: 第一節艙房在火車的前面。

sentences.english: Remember to place your luggage outside your cabin when you retire.
sentences.chinese: 記得退房時把行李擺在您的艙房門外。

sentences.english: The deck of the small cabin sharply pitched and bumped .
sentences.chinese: 這小艙房的甲板劇烈地顛簸了一下。

definition: standard (hotel) room/two-person room of standard size and amenities/abbr. to 标间
(jocularly) public building that has been lying idle (and is thus ideal for housing mosquitos) (Tw)
Liehyu township in Kinmen County 金門縣|金门县[Jin1 men2 xian4] (Kinmen or Quemoy islands), Taiwan
